RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Electronics and Microelectronics - Tashkent State Technical University (2000), mestrado em Modeling and Simulation of Complex Realities - The International Center for Theoretical Physics/Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati (2003) e o doutorado em Sciences Cognitives est sendo concludo no Institut National Polytechnique de Grenoble. Atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: complex systems in social sciences; interplay of crime, punishment, economic growth and inequality; game theory; modelization of collective phenomena in social systems taking into account the individuals' rationality as well as their adaptive and learning capabilities, in conditions of incomplete information;

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Computer skills: (1) Operating Systems: Windows, Linux; (2) Programming languages: C/C++; (3) Mathematical programs: Mathematica, Matlab, Origin

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Self-organization and emergence in complex (economic and social) systems
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: My main interest is the link between micro and macro behaviour: individual behaviour and socio-economic outcomes through social interaction. In the presence of interactions the relation between individual actions and aggregate outcomes become very complex. The collective states emerged as a consequence of these interactions are often intuitively inconsistent with the intentions of the individuals. The reason of these paradoxes is to be found in the fact that systems with interacting individuals may present multiple equilibria, which may be naturally analyzed in the framework of statistical physics.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Experimental study of coordination problems in the presence of suboptimal equilibria
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: The objective is to analyse how large groups of individuals coordinate their decisions in the presence of incomplete information. We use scientifically designed experiment to test theoretical predictions with real players under controlled laboratory conditions. We analyse the role of information as a coordination device. Finally, we develop learning models that help to explain the behaviour observed in the laboratory. Publication: "Informational-driven coordination with heterogeneous individuals", Semeshenko V., Gordon M.B., Garapin A., Ruffieux B., 2007, submitted to Theory and Decisions

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mtodos e Modelos Matemticos, Economtricos e Estatsticos

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Modeling criminal behaviors using an economic and statistical physics approaches
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: The objective is to analyse the economic origins and social costs of crime. I am interested in particular in the consequences of the punishment policy on the costs of crime, as well as the relationship between raising of income inequality and victimization. On the methodological side I use statistical physics and numerical simulations.

I am interested in modeling complex phenomena in social systems taking into account the individuals' rationality as well as their adaptive and learning capabilities, in the presence of incomplete information.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Interdisciplinary project ELICCIR ''Emergences, de l'Individu au Comportement Collectif: Interactions et Representations'', de l'ACI Systemes Complexes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The general objective of this project is to study the interplay between individual behaviors and emerged collective outcomes, in the domain of social sciences. In particular, we are focused on the following applications: markets; diffusion of public behaviour (violence); influence of the beliefs and social norms on the functionality of markets. This project is based on the cooperation among the four different domains: data collection and empirical analysis, experimental economics, multi-agent simulations, applied mathematics and statistical physics.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: cole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales de Paris
Centre for Research on Environmental Microbiology
Equipe Rseaux sur les March, l'Emploi et la Simulation
COLE NATIONALE SUPRIEURE DE GNIE INDUSTRIEL

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Project ''Coordination efficase en presence de choix sous optimaux de precaution'', de l'Institut de la production et des organisations Industrielles (IPI).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective is to design the mechanisms which enable an efficient coordination in large groups. In particular, we study the role of information as a coordination device in a stylized N-heterogeneous player coordination game. We play this game with real players in the laboratory under controlled conditions. The questions we address are: Can players coordinate or learn to coordinate on one of multiple equilibria? Are their ways to predict which equilibrium will be chosen? What are the mechanisms or conditions which would help players coordinate on the equilibrium which is individually and globally optimal? We interpret the empirical data using learning models.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Project ''AeDNS (Analyse economique de la Dynamique des Normes Sociales)'' des MSH Grenoble.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective of this project is to develop the methodology for the analysis of the emergence and evolution of norms, using economic and analytical approaches, as well as numerical multi-agent simulations
